metadata.title: CVE-2017-15010 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A ReDoS (regular expression denial of service) flaw was found in the tough-cookie module before 2.3.3 for Node.js. An attacker that is able to make an HTTP request using a specially crafted cookie may cause the application to consume an excessive amount of CPU.

criterions.comment: node-tough-cookie package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.4+dfsg-1').
